intro: Tarrietia albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered tarrietia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a soft, hairy texture.
